text: [Music]
hey guys it's angel today we are gonna
be making one of my favorite Taiwanese
desserts I know I have a lot of favorite
Taiwanese desserts but this one is my
super favorite because summer is coming
up I'm gonna show you guys how to make
Taiwanese shaved ice
also known as swap being now I know what
you're thinking we are going to need a
shaved ice machine and luckily I found
one that I really like and I feel like
works really well it comes with two of
these containers ice molds where you
fill it up with water you put it in your
freezer and then you have these really
nice ice pucks that go in the machine
and I feel like that gives you a really
nice super fluffy ice that's almost like
eating snow and for me I feel like this
household appliance gives you about 95
percent of the snow fluffiness as they
do in Taiwanese shaved ice shops and for
me that's good enough and I'm just then
going to worry about all the delicious
toppings that we're gonna put on top of
our shaved ice dessert so with that
let's get started first I'm starting
with a bag of sweet frozen mochi balls
these are super easy to cook just bring
a pot of water to a boil add your frozen
mochi balls and let it boil for three to
five minutes when they're ready they
should be floating and plump next
immediately drain and place them in a
bath of ice water to stop the cooling
process this will make them extra chewy
and what we call in Taiwanese q topping
number two is grass jelly it's kind of
like an herbal jello I bought mine
canned so I'm going to gently cut them
into smaller pieces with a knife and if
you've never had a bowl jelly before
don't be afraid because the color it's
one of my favorites
topping number three is some cooked
barley and topping number four are mung
beans now the barley and the mung beans
I cooked earlier from scratch using
dried barley and beans and I'll leave
instructions on my blog on how I did
this in my pressure cooker if you're
interested and finally the last topping
is sweetened condensed milk I'm opening
up a fresh can to drizzle over
everything and it is going to be so good
thumbs up if you guys like condensed
milk now even though I only used a few
toppings in today's recipe there are
other ones that
really like I like taro there's boiled
peanuts there's of course fresh fruit I
particularly like fresh mangoes and
fresh strawberries of course with more
sweetened condensed milk on top that
one's really good but as you can see the
toppings and the combinations are pretty
much endless once everything is ready
it's time to make the shaved ice take
the blocks of ice out and let it defrost
for five minutes before using and during
that time I like to put my bowl in the
freezer to keep everything extra chill
next remove the ice block from the mold
and place it in the shaved ice machine
assemble the cover on the machine and I
recommend testing it out to make sure
the ice shavings are the right
consistency before placing them in my
bowl once it's to your liking I'll go
ahead and start the fun part of shaving
the ice and making snow and if you're
wondering one ice block makes a big bowl
like this
[Music]
[Music]
now it's time to assemble add the crash
jelly in one corner of the bowl next
some mung beans and then some barley and
don't forget the chewy pink and white
mochi balls finally the most satisfying
part is the moment you get to drizzle
the sweetened condensed milk all over
the toppings and don't forget after
eating some you can always add more
sweet and condensed milk around to Oh
what am i doing I should do the ending
okay stay and that guys is how you make
Taiwanese shaved ice or swapping now I
think Mochis along with the sweetened
condensed milk are one of my favorite
toppings and I'm curious what's yours
post in the comments below and let me
know what's your favorite shaved ice
topping and I will see you in the next
video take care guys don't forget to
Like and subscribe and see you guys soon
bye

you love the sweetened condensed milk
so good
